runs.comm: not the most auspicious of starts. Then again they have enough on the board to get over a dibbly-dobbly wide down the leg side
back of a length on middle, with a touch of shape back in, Munsey is cautious and presents a straight bat
shortish and outside off, dabbed to point
good length ball targeting top of off, Munsey directs it to point
gets across on off stump to work the ball off good length to midwicket. Nice stump-to-stump lines now
zips in off the deck as Coetzer looks to make a bit too much of a good length ball. Goes for a pull against a good length ball, which beats him and thuds off his thigh pad to third man
good length ball outside off, pushed into the covers
flighted outside off, driven to mid-off for a single
reverse sweep! Top stuff from Munsey. Rapid switch of stance, Nabi doesn't adjust, bowls a length ball on middle which has been fairly hammered between point and short third man
again, but this time the reverse sweep doesn't quite work because Nabi bowls it slower and tosses it up on leg stump. Only gets a bit of an inside edge to short third man
dropped but that was travelling! Nabi is wringing his hands. Coetzer jumps down the track and gets a bit too close. Drills it back down the pitch and gets enough height and power to escape

the only man in the deep and he's picked him out! Moves outside off to open up the leg side -  good decision with the field up and he's hitting with the wind here - but his placement needs more work. Shenwari at square leg runs to his left and takes a fine catch
flighted outside off, sliced towards point
full on middle, clipped to midwicket.
length on middle, Coetzer has put a bit more behind this. Swung away and he's placed it well to the left of short midwicket
good length ball outside off, Coetzer goes for a big thwack over extra cover. Connects with fresh air
slower ball, the legcutter I think. Batsman tries to pull it away to fine leg, but it isn't that short. Glances off his pads and past the wicketkeeper to his left
inside edge! That's quick and gets to Coetzer earlier than he was hoping for. Goes for a slog with his feet not moving at all. Finds a boundary behind him, when he was looking for midwicket
slower ball on off stump, pushed in front of point
drags it short and Coetzer pummels it away to deep midwicket. Protection there
tossed up just outside off, MacLeod moves outside off and sweeps behind square leg
tosses it up into the blockhole and he gets dip! Goes inches past the off stump as the batsman suddenly realises he's in danger.
good length ball, pulled away strongly to deep midwicket
moves outside leg, Nabi follows him and gets the blockhole again. Squeezed to cover
nips down the track, but Nabi pulls off all the pace and his length is pulled back as well. Lovely bowling. Only affords a single into the covers
shortish and sliding down leg, MacLeod jumps inside the line and pulls it fine to the long leg boundary. Good stroke

sublime hit! Used the bowler's pace, used the wind as well to hit a six over long leg. And how he'd done that was he moved away to the off side, bent down low and scooped the ball from the base of off stump well over the boundary
shortish and outside off, punched to cover
shortish and outside off, cracked away through point
full on off stump, drilled to mid-off where the captain Stanikzai catches up with it
slowr, shorter ball outside off. He jumps down the track and pulls strongly to the left of deep midwicket. Aftab is the man down there, who slides and pulls it back in
fuller delivery on fifth stump, flayed to mid-off
fuller on off stump, slugged to mid-on

wanders across and scoops a length ball heading towards off stump over the short fine leg. Good shot, good plan. The key to that is picking the length, and it has to be length. Any fuller and that shot puts you in trouble
oooh, this time he goes for the reverse sweep and scarily for him it's a fuller delivery just outside off. That length is what flummoxes him. Could have hit off stump too
extra cover takes it! Moves away from the line to open up the off side but he can't get under the ball. Tries his hardest to hit it over the man, but it sits up for a reasonably simple catch
good length ball outside off, eased down to deep third man. That's the Powerplay done

punched into the covers, and it's a direct hit! He's struggling. He's struggling. He's gone! Yells in the stands as MacLeod departs. Mix-up between the two batsmen, Cross wanted the single all along but the MacLeod hesitated, so Cross hesitated too. In the end they go for it, MacLeod dives and does so quite well too. But he's short
good length ball on middle, nudged straight of midwicket for a single
slashed into the covers, where the fielder pulls off a good dive and keeps it to nothing. Afghanistan are pumped up
noise was bat hitting ground as Hamid goes up for an appeal for caught behind. Good, full delivery just outside off. beats him
shortish and slower outside off, he waits on it and slices to deep third man
full and tailing in on off stump, driven to long-off
starts off flat and wide, cut away to deep point
another short ball, which the batsman has smote over extra cover. Good shot from Cross. Moves outside leg and picks the gap wide of the sweeper
quicker and flatter outside off, slid off the open face behind point
that time it's a lot slower. Berrington was looking to defend, and the ball goes quite a way in the air. Course mid-off's back in the deep

excellent ball-striking! Again, it's off the back foot as he takes advantage of a short ball and powers it away over extra cover. Difficult shot to pull off, especially with the bowler angling the ball in at him. Picked it from outside leg and heaved it away
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
goes through to the keeper just a shade ootside off stump as Cross again backs away to cut. Doesn't connect
punches the good length ball away outside off through the covers
looks for the sweep off a good length ball, struck on the top flap of the front pad. Height says the umpire as he denies the appeal. Also outside the line
nice and full and a inch or so outside off, drilled down to long-off
that's a slower short ball outside off, batsman is in slog mode and he can't connect well. Looking leg side when he should have gone over the off side. Inside edge to deep square
into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket. A bit overpitched outside off and Berrington has smashed it away. Solid shot
pumped between deep midwicket and long-on. Dawlat and Shafiqullah seem to collide with each other as they tumble around trying to field the ball. Some good, hard hitting
fuller and outside off, he drags it around to the midwicket boundary with a slog sweep.
too short, think he pitched it halfway down! Bad length for a spinner and Cross has flat-bat  hammered it over long-on
shortish and outside off, punched to deep point
waits on it to try and beat point, but he doesn't quite manage it. Only a single because the fielders are all on the edge of the circle

away she goes to the straight boundary. This is an important over for Scotland, they've taken 20 off it. Tossed up on middle, he moves beside the ball and hits it straight down the ground. Good option, that's the short boundary. The required rate is still an abominable 11.7 at the halfway stage
slugged away to deep square leg, and the fielder was pulling his head back, worried about the ball skidding off the turf and hitting him. Powerful ball-striking here
oooh, has he hurt himself? This was an almost yorker on middle and leg, Cross was looking to bottom-hand drill it through midiwcket and jams the ball onto his boot
pushed full and outside off, goes for a big sweep, gets only an inside edge to long leg
low full toss just outside off, pushed to mid-off for a single
nicely struck, but he can't beat point. That's the fifty partnership though. Moves that front leg away and slices a low full toss to the right of point. Nabi's good
full and just a shade outside off, that's why he mistimes the sweep.. Not enough room, gets an inside edge onto boot. Time for a little hydration
pushed through full and outside leg, Cross goes for a reverse sweep. Poor option. Can't do it from that line. Beaten

great stuff! The ball was swirling, he was tracking it over his shoulder too! Great stuff from Nabi. The ball wasn't the best. A full toss, which Cross swings looking for deep midwicket. It goes off the outside half and travels down the pitch instead. Gets caught in the wind and veers left as well. Nabi spots all of it and adjusts so well
nails the yorker and Berrington can only jam his bat down and protect his stumps. Gee, this is good offspin bowling
that not so much! Full toss with some room and Berrington makes some more as he takes that front leg away. Hammers it to extra cover, and beats Shenwari
shortish, slow and outside off, Tapped away to deep point
good length ball on middle, tucked to midwicket and Nabi races across to it himself
full toss on middle, punched to long-on

slower ball, dragged from outside off and into the midwicket boundary. Berrington has taken over from Cross. Picked the short boundary and is doing what his team needs. Slog sweep is Scotland's savior
full and outside off, pushed through the covers
hits the yorker just outside off, run into the covers

not enough room, not enough room but he has to hit out. Full and just outside off, slugged down the ground. Doesn't get enough elevation because he didn't get under it well enough. Simple catch at long-on
shortish and outside off, goes for a cross-batted heave and doesn't connect
starts off with a short and wide one which is clattered away to deep point
down the track, makes some room and creams a flighted delivery on middle back at the bowler

again doesn't allow the ball to get past him. Comes out of the front of the hand so not much turn. It was meant to cramp the batsman. But Mommsen makes room and drills it looking for long-on. Sami dives across
stays legside of it again and lifts the good length ball from leg stump over extra cover. Top shot
pushed through on middle and leg, punched to the left of the bowler and Shenwari is quickly across to it again
charges, but the length he wants isn't there. Credit to Sami for seeing it early and shortening his length. Sliced to point
sets up in a strong, wide and low stance outside off to target the leg side. It's a length ball too, but it's too far outside off. Skirts under the the bat
full and curling in a touch. Mommsen squeezes it behind point and makes a good enough connection for the ball to skip away. Beautifully done. He's made runs off a proper yorker there
slower ball off the back of the hand, and it's short as well. Mommsen moves outside off and pulls it with the wind over deep square leg
length! Disappears out of the ground! Biggest hit of the day. Scotland captain, take a bow. Gets down on one knee and slugs it away with monumental power
another one! Its full on off stump, he's camping deep in his crease and shovels the ball up and over wide long-on. Excellent hitting
full and wide outside off, Mommsen hits a piecing drive behind point and makes a couple. Good, desperate batting from the Scottish captain. That's 24 off the over
that's a good start to his innings. Jumps down the track, doens't care that Sami has shifted his length to a shorter one. But there's enough width to be smeared through the covers
races down again, but gets too close to the tossed up ball outside off. Inside edge wanders to long leg
quicker delivery slides down the leg side, sweep shot misses
slows it right down and tosses it up. Mommsen looks for the sweep, gets an inside edge off the sweep

dropped the ball as he stumps him. Beats the charging batsman with the flight, and then the lack of turn as the ball sneaks between inside edge and the leg. Shahzad has muffed this opportunity. Doesn't stay low enough. Hard hands as well
tossed up outside off, punched down the ground. Shenwari tries to stop it himself as he dives to his right, but doesn't quite do a good job
that's an excellent shot under pressure. He's been looking for the square boundaries and misting his sweeps. So now he trusts his power and swings down the ground.
squirted off the inside edge to deep midwicket. Doesn't like that it's just a single as he jogs across and slams his bat into his pad
full toss outside off, takes a thick outside edge and soars away to the third man boundary. That's very very timely. Is this a no-ball though. Nope. It's legal, Mommsen's not pleased
shot! It's full and outside off, Mommsen heaves it away to deep midwicket
full and speared in on off stump, gets a thick inside edge to long leg. FIfty partnership again

that's the last nail in the coffin? It's a full toss, Mommsen this time gets under this a bit too much. Gets way too much height on the swipe over wide long-on. Shafiqullah runs to his right and takes a good, sliding catch
full and pushed into the pads, he is very nervous behind it. Looks to nudge it away. has to settle for a leg bye

skis down the track, gets it on the full and flicks it down the throat of deep midwicket. Hit it well enough, but didn't pick the gap. Leask is utterly disconsolate as he stands in the middle of the pitch, while Shahzad exults wildly
another low full toss that's pushed to long-on
full on the base of leg stump, pushed to long-off
slog sweep again, but there is protection at deep square leg
fires in on the pads, clipped away wide of long-on for a couple. Good shot
fires it on on middle and leg and the batsman can only punch it back at the bowler
off comes middle! Its full, it's straight, it's fast. The tailender swings and misses, the ball kisses the pads and deflects onto the stumps. de Lange walks back head down.
bowls the yorker off the short run and gets it to reverse swing. Just about kept out
another excellent yorker just outside off, Evans swings and misses

another one, cleaned him up with a top-class yorker. Full on middle and off, Evans swings helplessly. Had no chance. Is something the matter with him though? Didn't celebrate at all, and went down on his haunches. A back problem?
goes around the wicket to the left-handed Watt. Driven into the coveres
full toss outside off, he throws his bat at it and gets a bottom edge past the keeper
slower ball outside off, Sharif moves away to try and smear it over the off side. No connection
is that it? Well taken at long-on. It's the slower ball again, legcutter. The batsman goes for a wild swing, mistimes it. Shafiqullah runs in and takes it nicely.
